clinical_study.brief_title: Longitudinal Effect of Electroconvulsive Therapy on Schizophrenia and Bipolar Disorder: a MRI Study
clinical_study.official_title: Longitudinal Effect of Electroconvulsive Therapy on Schizophrenia and Bipolar Disorder: a MRI Study

brief_summary.textblock: For more severe and treatment-resistant cases in schizophrenia and bipolar disorder, electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) is often very effective. The purpose of this study is to investigate the brain structure and function changes after ECT treatment. The neuroimaging marker which may predict the outcome of ECT is also studied in this research.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of Positive And Negative Syndrome Scale(PANSS)for Schizophrenia;
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 time points: baseline, the end of the three-week treatment，3 months after ECT or drugs treatment
primary_outcome.description: Scales changes from baseline will be documented after three weeks treatment and 3 months follow-up visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Bech—Rafaelsen Mania Rating Scale (BRMS) for Bipolar disorder
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 time points: baseline, the end of the three-week treatment，3 months after ECT or drugs treatment
primary_outcome.description: Scales changes from baseline will be documented after three weeks treatment and 3 months follow-up visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Hamilton Anxiety Scale (HAMA) for Bipolar disorder
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 time points: baseline, the end of the three-week treatment，3 months after ECT or drugs treatment
primary_outcome.description: Scales changes from baseline will be documented after three weeks treatment and 3 months follow-up visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Hamilton depression scale (HAMD) for Bipolar disorder
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 time points: baseline, the end of the three-week treatment，3 months after ECT or drugs treatment
primary_outcome.description: Scales changes from baseline will be documented after three weeks treatment and 3 months follow-up visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of brain gray matter, white matter and functional based on MRI data analysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 time points:baseline, the end of the three-week treatment]
secondary_outcome.description: The changes of gray matter volume,structural integrity of white matter,and brain function during resting state after treatment will be analyzed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 time points: baseline, the end of the three-week treatment，3 months after ECT or drugs treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Scale change from baseline will be documented after three weeks treatment and 3 months follow-up visit.

arm_group.description: Patients received bilateral temporal modified ECT (MECT) for three weeks,four times a week. Meanwhile, they also had antipsychotic drugs.
Patients only received antipsychotic drugs during observation period.

intervention.description: Patients had bilateral temporal modified ECT four times a week for 3 consecutive weeks
